</image>   <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;1384684e.1503">   <title>Fwd: Developing the Information Governance Toolkit - request for help from HSCIC </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;1384684e.1503</link>   <description> Apologies for cross posting this in order to draw it to the attention of<br>those who may have a view<br><br>*Gill Kaye*<br><br>Assistant Librarian<br>Illingworth Library<br>Sheffield Children's Hospital<br>Western Bank<br>Sheffield S10 2TH<br><br>---------- Forwarded message ----------<br>From: Malcolm Teague &lt;Malcolm.Teague@jisc.ac.uk&gt;<br>Date: 9 March 2015 at 14:13<br>Subject: Developing the Information Governance Toolkit - request for help<br>from HSCIC<br>To: NHS-HE-FORUM@jiscmail.ac.uk<br><br>Dear All, circulating this on behalf of the HSCIC who have just launched<br>this survey to gather views on the Information Governance Toolkit given the<br>commitment to a major review. Please can you circulate to all with an<br> [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-09T14:22:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Gill Kaye</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;1384684e.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;b9513e01.1503">   <title>Exciting study day in Leicester, on making your library service visible and essential to users - Last few spaces available! </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;b9513e01.1503</link>   <description> [cid:image001.jpg@01D057FD.544E1490]<br>Make your library service visible and essential to users<br>23rd April 2015<br>Final few spaces left<br><br>A workshop for health librarians on taking your services to your customers, with practical strategies and a chance to share good practice with colleagues.<br><br>If I Google your library service what will I find? Can I tweet an enquiry? Are you proactively sending me the information I need to do my job, be it as a clinician or a manager?<br>If these questions are playing on your mind then we can help find solutions. We are running a workshop for Health Librarians on [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-03-06T11:04:34+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hull Louise - Clinical Librarian</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;b9513e01.1503</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;149b7b45.1502">   <title>FW: Vacancy - Library and Knowledge Service Manager - Derby Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;149b7b45.1502</link>   <description> ++ Apologies for cross-posting ++<br><br>We are seeking a new LKS Service Manager in Derby.<br>Please see details below for Job Ref No. (www.jobs.nhs.uk&lt;http://www.jobs.nhs.uk/&gt;) and for further information.<br><br>Many Thanks,<br>Lisa<br><br>Lisa Lawrence, BA(Hons), MScEcon<br>Clinical Librarian, Library &amp; Knowledge Service, Education Centre, Royal Derby Hospital, Uttoxeter Road, Derby, DE22 3NE<br>Tel: (01332) 788155 Fax: (01332) 789233<br>Email: Lisa.Lawrence4@nhs.net<br>Library Intranet: http://flo//training-development/library-knowledge-service<br>Twitter: @DHFTLibrary    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-26T09:07:29+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Lawrence Lisa (DERBY HOSPITALS NHS FOUNDATION TRUST)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;149b7b45.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;d9c2d3d1.1502">   <title>A survey on library staff co-authorship and acknowledgement </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;d9c2d3d1.1502</link>   <description> Dear Colleagues,<br><br>We are writing to request your participation in a survey on library staff co-authorship and acknowledgement in publications. We are pursuing an understanding of the practice and attitude of librarians in regards to co-authorship and acknowledgement in publications for which they completed work.<br><br>The link to the survey: https://redcap1.mayo.edu/surveys/index.php?hash=1068c6e4c8051cfd4e9ea8072e3189e2<br><br>This is a research project and completion of this survey is completely voluntary. The research project and survey were reviewed by IRB and deemed exempt. We appreciate your time and effort in completing the survey, which will most likely take you 5 to 15 minutes to complete. Results will [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-23T23:10:18+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Catherine Voutier</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;d9c2d3d1.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;7ccdd1d8.1502">   <title>REMINDER: ICLC 2015 at EAHIL </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;7ccdd1d8.1502</link>   <description> Dear Clinical &amp; Outreach Librarian colleagues,<br><br>We are collaborating with the European Association for Health Information and Libraries (EAHIL) and the International Conference of Animal Health Information Specialists (ICAHIS) to host a Workshop from 10-12 June 2015 in Edinburgh, UK. The joint EAHIL+ICAHIS+ICLC Workshop format will mostly be participative workshop sessions - for more information, please see https://eahil2015.wordpress.com [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-23T12:34:33+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Divall Pip - Clinical Librarian Service Manager</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;7ccdd1d8.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;4e49eb50.1502</link>   <description> Might be of interest?<br><br>Jacqui Watkeys BA MCLIP<br>Head of Library and Knowledge Services<br><br>Library and Knowledge Services<br>Tel: 01922 656628 ext: 6628<br><br>Walsall Healthcare NHS Trust<br><br>Walsall Manor Hospital<br><br>Moat Road,<br><br>Walsall<br><br>West Midlands<br><br>WS2 9PS.<br>[Description: Description: prom]<br>www.walsallhealthcare.nhs.uk&lt;http://www.walsallhealthcare.nhs.uk/&gt;<br><br>[cid:image003.jpg@01D04A93.BC9F9F90]&lt;http://www.basedoc.co.uk/&gt;<br><br>[App]&lt;https://www.walsallhealthcare.nhs.uk/handbook&gt;<br><br>[Description: Description: Description: Description: OpenAthens button2.png]&lt;https://register.athensams.net/nhs/nhseng/&gt;<br><br>From: Discussion list for Health Libraries Group HLG members [mailto:HLG-MEMBERS@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Gray Anne (NHS GREATER EAST MIDLANDS COMMISSIONING SUPPORT UNIT)<br>Sent: 17 February 2015 09:13<br>To: HLG-MEMBERS@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Clinical Librarian report on NHS of the Academy of Fabulous NHS Stuff [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-17T09:25:57+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Watkeys Jacqui (RBK) Walsall Healthcare NHS UK</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;4e49eb50.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;20dac670.1502">   <title>Re: Another Medline query </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;20dac670.1502</link>   <description> Hi<br><br>Are you getting a lot less?<br><br>Being in Wales I don't use HDAS but in OVID MEDLINE the full record set accumulates duplicate records over the year when NLM submits corrections or alterations to the original - these are rationalized over the annual reload so will disappear.<br><br>This may account for some?????? [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-10T08:42:03+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Bernadette Coles (Velindre - Library)</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;20dac670.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;ee168181.1502">   <title>Another Medline query </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;ee168181.1502</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>I'm re-running a search in HDAS that I last ran in late December, for a systematic review I'm working on. Now when I run the search, I'm actually finding I get fewer results than previously. Does anyone know why this might be the case?<br><br>Also, I've been de-duplicating the search so as to get a definitive total for the flowchart. There were too many results, so I split them by year, and then deduplicated each year set. Except for the final set which keeps crashing HDAS for me time and again, even though the combined total is well [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-09T16:31:11+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Divall Pip - Clinical Librarian Service Manager</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;ee168181.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;8a458b9f.1502">   <title>Life is better by the beach: we're looking for a Clinical Librarian and a Primary Care Specialist Librarian </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;8a458b9f.1502</link>   <description> Life is better by the beach. Information work evolves quickly. At Brighton and Sussex NHS Library and Knowledge Services we are ahead of the game, with a team of dynamic and enthusiastic colleagues, exploring different ways of working and expanding. We are not the finished article, but we are leading the way. Come and join us and help mould our future.<br>We are recruiting to two posts, a second Clinical Librarian to help strengthen and broaden our mature service to selected clinical teams in the acute trust, and a Primary Care Specialist Librarian, a new post to meet increasing demand [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-02-06T12:41:39+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Roper, Tom</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;8a458b9f.1502</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;83e3178b.1501">   <title>Search Help Please! </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;83e3178b.1501</link>   <description> Dear All<br>I have been given a search question which I find it very difficult and I would appreciate if you could guide me towards the right direction.<br><br>The question is: in adult patients diagnosed in childhood with Hypopituitarism how do surgical treatment compared to medical treatment (medication I suppose) differ in the fertility/pregnancy outcome in adulthood? [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-29T12:49:18+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Bannerman Fariba</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;83e3178b.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;81772c9b.1501">   <title>Re: HDAS </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;81772c9b.1501</link>   <description> Hi Genny,<br><br>I get the following message &quot;The DSP identifier you specified is invalid&quot;. Is this similar to you?<br><br>Kind regards<br>Liz<br><br>Liz Chalmers<br>Library and Knowledge Service Manager<br>Stenhouse Library<br>Kingston Hospital NHS Foundation Trust<br>Galsworthy Road<br>Kingston<br>KT2 7QB<br>020 8934 2234<br>07817 489 469 (Monday-Friday 09:00-17:00)<br><br>-----Original Message-----<br>From: The UK Clinical Librarian mailing list [mailto:CLIN-LIB@JISCMAIL.AC.UK] On Behalf Of Franklin Genny (RGC) Librarian<br>Sent: 29 January 2015 07:34<br>To: CLIN-LIB@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: HDAS [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-29T08:05:59+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Chalmers, Elisabeth</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;81772c9b.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;32b90c5a.1501">   <title>HDAS </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;32b90c5a.1501</link>   <description> Okay so morning meltdown ... is anyone able to get into HDAS right now?<br><br>It went down for me at 7pm last night and no ability to get in since.<br><br>Best,<br><br>Genny<br><br>Genny Franklin<br>Clinical and Research Support Librarian<br>Barts Health NHS Trust<br><br>Email: genny.franklin@bartshealth.nhs.uk<br>Mob: 07963 010477<br><br>Library website: http://www.bartshealth.nhs.uk/library/<br>Library catalogue: http://bartshealth.nhslibraries.com/    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-29T07:33:48+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Franklin Genny (RGC) Librarian</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;32b90c5a.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;7e0c1df6.1501">   <title>Searching in context - homonyms, etymological issues, sequencing events </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;7e0c1df6.1501</link>   <description> Apols for cross posting    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-28T15:39:56+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Michelle Maden</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;7e0c1df6.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;1c5cb3bd.1501">   <title>Patient Information Librarian job descriptions </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;1c5cb3bd.1501</link>   <description> With apologies for cross posting.<br><br>Dear all,<br><br>I wondered if anyone out there would be so kind as to supply me with job descriptions and person specifications for Patient Information or similar librarian roles?<br><br>I have a couple of other questions too:<br><br>* How do patients make contact with the service you provide?<br><br>* Do you have a dedicated portion of the library for the service? E.g. a special section, office, etc. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-28T13:12:32+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Divall Pip - Clinical Librarian Service Manager</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;1c5cb3bd.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;608dc65e.1501">   <title>Re: Using the "Humans" limit in Medline </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;608dc65e.1501</link>   <description> Hi Pip,<br><br>Carole Lefebvre talked about this at an Advanced Search techniques course in York last October (http://www.yhec.co.uk/training/). If i understood correctly by using the humans filter, you get all papers that are indexed as human, including any papers that are indexed under both animal and human.<br><br>But there are over 500 records indexed in Medline as an RCT that have neither animal or human indexing, so just the human filter will miss these.<br>So, using the not.. not... strategy, you remove only papers that are solely indexed as animal studies and keep everything else. [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-23T12:37:09+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Elaine Garrett</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;608dc65e.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;c2dd0062.1501">   <title>ICLC 2015 at EAHIL </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;c2dd0062.1501</link>   <description> Dear Clinical &amp; Outreach Librarian colleagues,<br><br>We are collaborating with the European Association for Health Information and Libraries (EAHIL) and the International Conference of Animal Health Information Specialists (ICAHIS) to host a Workshop from 10-12 June 2015 in Edinburgh, UK. The joint EAHIL+ICAHIS+ICLC Workshop format will mostly be participative workshop sessions - for more information, please see https://eahil2015.wordpress.com [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-22T11:01:09+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hull Louise - Clinical Librarian</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;c2dd0062.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;632afe25.1501">   <title>Using the "Humans" limit in Medline </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;632afe25.1501</link>   <description> Dear all,<br><br>Apologies for cross-posting. I'm doing some work with the Musculoskeletal team who are working on some national guidelines, and I have been asked what the difference is between using the line<br><br>ANIMALS/ NOT (HUMANS/ AND ANIMALS/)<br>Then running the whole search NOT this line<br><br>Versus using the HUMANS/ filter.<br><br>So I have run the search in HDAS to compare, and the difference appears to be 2000+ articles that have no indexing (I've checked). I'm not sure why this is? I have to admit here that this is not my strategy; it's one prescribed by the guidelines group and [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-22T08:40:08+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Divall Pip - Clinical Librarian Service Manager</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;632afe25.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;3487489e.1501">   <title>Wanted...your favourite videos/animations on doing a literature search </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;3487489e.1501</link>   <description> APOLOGIES FOR CROSS-POSTING    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-20T20:03:52+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Michelle Maden</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;3487489e.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;ab7201e6.1501">   <title>Job Descriptions </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;ab7201e6.1501</link>   <description> Apologies for cross-posting<br><br>Dear Colleagues,<br><br>We are looking at developing our team, I am interested if anyone has any Band 5 Clinical or E-Learning Librarian Job Descriptions that they would be willing to share?<br><br>Many thanks in advance<br><br>Kind regards<br>Liz<br><br>Liz Chalmers<br>Library and Knowledge Service Manager<br>Stenhouse Library<br>Kingston Hospital NHS Foundation Trust<br>Galsworthy Road<br>Kingston<br>KT2 7QB<br>020 8934 2234<br>07817 489 469 (Monday-Friday 09:00-17:00) [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-16T10:35:44+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Chalmers, Elisabeth</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;ab7201e6.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;7b897bc9.1501">   <title>New Year - time to book yourself on an exciting workshop to make your library service visible and essential to users! </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;7b897bc9.1501</link>   <description> Dear All<br><br>We still have some places left on our workshop, so book now to get a chance to share with colleagues who are facing the same challenges as you are: How to deliver excellent targeted services in resource challenged times, how to ensure that your customers know about the library and value its services. Move from New Year's resolutions to New Years actions! [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-15T10:46:55+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Sutton Sarah - Clinical Librarian</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;7b897bc9.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;82fb9fcc.1501">   <title>FW: Three Evidence-Based Health Care Career Enhancement Scholarships worth \ufffd\ufffd1,970 each</title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;82fb9fcc.1501</link>   <description> From: University of Oxford CPD Centre [mailto:cpdhealth@CONTED.OX.AC.UK]<br>Sent: 13 January 2015 11:22<br>To: CLIN-LIB@JISCMAIL.AC.UK<br>Subject: Three Evidence-Based Health Care Career Enhancement Scholarships worth \ufffd\ufffd1,970 each<br><br>Evidence-Based Health Care Career Enhancement Scholarship \ufffd\ufffd\ufffd helping gifted individuals advance their skills in evidence-based health care and improve practice.<br><br>The Postgraduate Programme in Evidence-Based Health Care is offering a Career Enhancement Scholarship to one exceptional applicant per course as detailed below. The Scholarship will cover the full cost of tuition fees (\ufffd\ufffd1,970) but excludes the cost of travel, accommodation and subsistence. The student is expected to cover these costs. For further details on how [...]   </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-13T11:26:29+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Divall Pip - Clinical Librarian Service Manager</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;82fb9fcc.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;67a456d0.1501">   <title>ISHIMR 2015 - Register you place at the conference today! </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;67a456d0.1501</link>   <description> Dear Colleague,<br><br>The organizing committee of the ISHIMR 2015 Committee recently announced the 17th International Symposium for Health Information Management Research (ISHIMR), which will take place on 25-26 June 2015, at York St John University, in York, England, UK. ISHIMR 2015 is a collaboration between York St John University and the University of Sheffield. [...]    </description>   <dc:date>2015-01-12T14:37:07+00:00</dc:date>   <dc:creator>Hannah Spring</dc:creator>   <dc:identifier>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;67a456d0.1501</dc:identifier> </item>  <item rdf:about="https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;af81f5b5.1501">   <title>Primary Care Specialist Librarian, NHS Band 6 </title>   <link>https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=CLIN-LIB;af81f5b5.1501</link>   <description> Members of the list may be interested in this vacancy. In this new post you will work closely with NHS staff in general practice and primary care, using expert search and appraisal skills to expand their use of evidence. Regular travel throughout Brighton &amp; Hove and the surrounding areas will be essential as you make contacts and work alongside this difficult-to-reach staff group.
